cards.text: What is the environment where negligible amounts of dust, pollution, etc. are present called? (Clean environment/Dirty environment)
Identify the type of waste shown in the figure. (Non-degradable waste/Degradable waste)
It is not the responsibility of the society to clean the surroundings of the different places of society. True or False?
Identify the type of waste shown in the figure. (Non-degradable waste/Degradable waste)
What is the environment where a high amount of dust, pollution, germs, insects, bad smells, etc. are present? (Polluted environment/Healthy environment)
The wastes produced from a kitchen and cow sheds can be used to produce compost manure. True or False?
Throwing garbage and waste on the road is a ____ habit. (good/bad)
Keeping the sources of water clean ____ various diseases. (transmits/does not transmit)
We ____ throw waste on roads and streets. (should/should not)
Waste materials cannot be recycled. True or False?

description: Read the questions properly and write the correct answer.
